paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a case of systemic amyloidosis with a focus on the TTR gene variant Val30Met, detailing penetrance data and clinical implications.

patients.phenotype: Late-onset hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with peripheral neuropathy and autonomic dysfunction.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Peripheral neuropathy, severe sensory ataxia, and autonomic dysfunction.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: At the age of 69 years, a liver transplant was not indicated due to the risk associated with age, low body mass index, and renal dysfunction.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with clinical and electrophysiological heterogeneity.
assays: Laser microdissection and mass spectrometry analysis (LC/MS)

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in a patient with a family history suggestive of hereditary amyloidosis.
variants.source_location: Case Report, paragraph discussing the patient's mutation
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a family history that was initially unclear, complicating the diagnosis.
key_quotes: This information led us to search for a mutation in the TTR gene to find a heterozygous Val30Met mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information regarding the TTR variant.
